Sentencas: The paper presents an elementary reaction based solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) model coupled with anodic elementary heterogeneous reactions and electrochemical charge transfer reactions for CO/CO(2) fuel based on an anode supported button cell.
Titulo: Experimental characterization and mechanistic modeling of carbon monoxide fueled solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The model is calibrated and validated using experimental data obtained for various CO/CO(2) fuel compositions at 750, 800 and 850 degrees C.
Titulo: Experimental characterization and mechanistic modeling of carbon monoxide fueled solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The comparison shows that the modeling results agree well with the experimental data.
Titulo: Experimental characterization and mechanistic modeling of carbon monoxide fueled solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The effects of operating conditions on the cell performance and the detailed species concentration distribution are predicted.
Titulo: Experimental characterization and mechanistic modeling of carbon monoxide fueled solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Then, the carbon deposition on the SOFC anode with CO/CO(2) fuel is experimentally measured and simulated using the elementary reaction model.
Titulo: Experimental characterization and mechanistic modeling of carbon monoxide fueled solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The results indicate that lower temperature and lower operation voltage are helpful to reduce the possibilities of carbon deposition on Ni particle surfaces.
Titulo: Experimental characterization and mechanistic modeling of carbon monoxide fueled solid oxide fuel cell
